content.description:
Timestretcher climbs is a short but entertaining lowball that requires a fair amount of gumption.

Sit start with a great left hand edge and a right hand gaston. From there, pull up to a right hand undercling, then make a big left hand move to the lip, from there, traverse left (to avoid the tree branches) up the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center of Monoglot's north face.

content.description:
Hootenanny is a lowball that climbs solid stone on unique holds. The start holds alone are reason enough to get on it.

Sit start with a perfect right hand edge and pair of slits/pinch with the left hand. From there, pull up to a right hand gaston, bump the same hand to a jagged mono edge, then reach a left hand sidepull, tip toe the feet, reach the lip, throw up an edge, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work, the problem climbs over a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the left side of Monoglot's north face.
